data.name: Rare Candy
rules: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 1 or Stage 2 card that evolves from that Pokémon in your hand, put that card on the Basic Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) If you choose a Stage 2 Pokémon in your hand, put that Pokémon on the Basic Pokémon instead of on a Stage 1 Pokémon.

data.name: Wynaut

abilities.name: Peppy Pick
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

data.flavorText: It tends to move in a pack with others. They cluster in a tight group to sleep in a cave.

data.name: Lycanroc

attacks.name: Dangerous Rogue
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Bathed in the setting sun of evening, Lycanroc has undergone a special kind of evolution. An intense fighting spirit underlies its calmness.

attacks.text: If Snorlax is Asleep, this attack does 20 damage plus 30 more damage. (This attack can be used even if Snorlax is Asleep.)

attacks.name: Heavy Press
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage. If tails, Snorlax is now Asleep.

data.name: Marowak BREAK
rules: BREAK Evolution Rule: Marowak BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

attacks.name: Bone Revenge
attacks.text: This attack does 40 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy card attached to Torchic.

data.name: Poochyena

attacks.name: Howl in the Dark
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Darkness Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: It has a very tenacious nature. Its acute sense of smell lets it chase a chosen prey without ever losing track.

data.name: Energy Root
rules: Attach Energy Root to 1 of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex and Pokémon that has Dark or an owner in its name) that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If the Pokémon Energy Root is attached to is Pokémon-ex or has Dark or an owner in its name, discard Energy Root.
As long as Energy Root is attached to a Pokémon, that Pokémon gets +20 HP and can't use any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies.

data.name: Aegislash

abilities.name: Stance Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch this Pokémon with an Aegislash in your hand. (Any cards attached to this Pokémon, damage counters, Special Conditions, turns in play, and any other effects remain on the new Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Buster Swing
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.flavorText: Generations of kings were attended by these Pokémon, which used their spectral power to manipulate and control people and Pokémon.

data.name: Nosepass

attacks.name: Pull
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When endangered, it may protect itself by raising its magnetism and drawing iron objects to its body.

data.name: Magnezone

abilities.name: Magnetic Circuit
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Metal Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Zap Cannon
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Zap Cannon during your next turn.

data.flavorText: As it zooms through the sky, this Pokémon seems to be receiving signals of unknown origin, while transmitting signals of unknown purpose.

data.name: Chikorita

attacks.name: Sleep Scent
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: It uses the leaf on its head to determine the temperature and humidity. It loves to sunbathe.

data.name: Department Store Girl
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Search your deck for up to 3 Pokémon Tool cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Whismur

attacks.name: Round
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of your Pokémon that have the Round attack.

data.flavorText: If it senses danger, it scares the foe by crying out with the volume of a jet-plane engine.

data.name: Lillipup

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.flavorText: The long hair around its face provides an amazing radar that lets it sense subtle changes in its surroundings.

data.name: Goodra

abilities.name: Slip Trip
abilities.text: Each player can't attach any Pokémon Tool cards from his or her hand to any of his or her Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dragon Pulse
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your deck.

data.flavorText: This very friendly Dragon-type Pokémon will hug its beloved Trainer, leaving that Trainer covered in sticky slime.

data.name: Sableye

attacks.name: Limitation
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Supporter cards from their hand during their next turn.

data.flavorText: It's a fiend for gemstones, so it stalks Carbink. Unfortunately, Gabite almost always grabs them first.

data.name: Kingdra

attacks.name: Dragon Vortex
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of Water Energy cards and Lightning Energy cards in your discard pile. Then, shuffle all of those cards back into your deck.

attacks.name: Tri Bullet
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 3 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It lives in caves on the seafloor and creates giant whirlpools every time it moves.

data.name: Energy Switch
rules: Move a basic Energy card attached 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Energy Draw
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to Electabuzz. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Reflect Energy
attacks.text: If you have any Benched Pokémon and if there are any basic Energy cards attached to Electabuzz, take 1 of those Energy cards and attach it to 1 of those Pokémon.

data.name: Relicanth

attacks.name: Grand Swell
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon for each Pokémon Tool and Stadium card your opponent has in play. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: A rare Pokémon discovered during a deep-sea exploration. It has not changed in over 100 million years.

data.name: Buffer Piece
rules: Attach Buffer Piece to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.

Damage done to the Pokémon Buffer Piece is attached to by an opponent's attack is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). At the end of your opponent's turn after you played Buffer Piece, discard Buffer Piece.

data.name: Dedenne

attacks.name: Mad Party
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile that has the Mad Party attack.

data.flavorText: Its upper whiskers are sensors that survey its surroundings. Its lower whiskers are organs that shoot electricity.

data.name: Pokémon Center
rules: Remove all damage counters from all of your own Pokémon with damage counters on them, then discard all Energy cards attached to those Pokémon.

data.name: Mewtwo

abilities.name: Pressure
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Active Pokémon's attack do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: A Pokémon created by recombining Mew's genes. It's said to have the most savage heart among Pokémon.

data.name: Warp Point
rules: Your opponent switches 1 of his or her Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. You switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, if any.

data.name: Haunter

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Its tongue is made of gas. If licked, its victim starts shaking constantly until death eventually comes.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from Wurmple and put it on Wurmple. (This counts as evolving Wurmple.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Miracle Essence
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Special Condition. Each Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

attacks.name: Dig Under
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Severe Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 4 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Burrow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done by attacks to Diglett during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

data.name: Darkrai

attacks.name: Hide in Shadows
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Hole
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: To protect itself, it afflicts those around it with nightmares. However, it means no harm.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Pangoro

attacks.name: Parting Shot
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 60 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Buster Swing
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.flavorText: It charges ahead and bashes its opponents like a berserker, uncaring about any hits it might take. Its arms are mighty enough to snap a telephone pole.

data.name: Pachirisu

attacks.name: Overshort
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tool cards from your opponent's Active Pokémon. If you discarded a Pokémon Tool card in this way, this attack does 40 more damage, and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

data.name: Memory Berry
rules: Attach Memory Berry to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.

The Pokémon this card is attached to can use any attack from its Basic Pokémon or its Stage 1 Evolution card. (You still have to pay for that attack's Energy cost.) If that Pokémon attacks, discard this card at the end of the turn.

data.name: Venonat

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Remove from Venonat the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Poison oozes from all over its body. It catches and eats small bugs at night that are attracted by light.

attacks.name: Confusion Wave
attacks.text: Both Slowpoke and the Defending Pokémon are now Confused.

data.name: Nidoran ♂

attacks.name: Horn Hazard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Stiffens its ears to sense danger. The larger, more powerful of its horns secretes venom.

data.name: Croagunk

attacks.name: Ghastly Sound
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Supporter cards from his or her hand during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Finger Poke
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Its cheeks hold poison sacs. It tries to catch foes off guard to jab them with toxic fingers.

data.name: Potion Energy
rules: If you play this card from your hand, remove 1 damage counter from the Pokémon you attach it to, if it has any.
Potion Energy provides Colorless energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

data.name: Absol

attacks.name: Future Sight
attacks.text: Look at the top 4 cards of either player's deck and put them back in any order.

attacks.name: Doom News
attacks.text: Put all Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand. At the end of your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon will be Knocked Out.

data.flavorText: Long ago, superstitions were spread about it, saying it brought disaster. This fed a hatred of it, and it was driven deep into the mountains.

data.name: Aegislash

abilities.name: Stance Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch this Pokémon with an Aegislash in your hand. (Any cards attached to this Pokémon, damage counters, Special Conditions, turns in play, and any other effects remain on the new Pokémon.)

attacks.name: King's Shield
attacks.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn. This Pokémon can't use King's Shield during your next turn.

data.flavorText: Generations of kings were attended by these Pokémon, which used their spectral power to manipulate and control people and Pokémon.

data.name: Pokémon Fan Club
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Unfezant

ancientTrait.name: Δ Evolution
ancientTrait.text: You may play this card from your hand to evolve a Pokémon during your first turn or the turn you play that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Feather Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, each of this Pokémon's attacks does 80 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Sky Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Males have plumage on their heads. They will never let themselves feel close to anyone other than their Trainers.

data.name: Onix

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever 30 or less damage is done to Onix (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

data.flavorText: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, though colored black.

data.name: Gengar

abilities.name: Life Shaker
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Psychic Pokémon to another of your Psychic Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: On the night of a full moon, if shadows move on their own and laugh, it must be Gengar's doing.

abilities.name: Freefloating
abilities.text: If Tentacool has no Energy attached to it, Tentacool's Retreat Cost is 0.

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Bubbles
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, you can't use this attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Totodile

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Totodile but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

data.flavorText: Its highly developed jaws are powerful enough to crush anything. Even experienced adult trainers must handle it with great caution.

data.name: Piplup

attacks.name: Muddy Water
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: A poor walker, it often falls down. However, its strong pride makes it puff up its chest without a care.

data.name: Alolan Rattata

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Bite attack's base damage is 60.

data.flavorText: With its incisors, it gnaws through doors and infiltrates people's homes. Then, with a twitch of its whiskers, it steals whatever food it finds.

data.name: Energy Switch
rules: Move a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

data.name: Dialga

attacks.name: Time Freeze
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Pokémon from his or her hand to evolve the Defending Pokémon during his or her next turn.

data.flavorText: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

data.name: Herdier

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

data.flavorText: It loyally follows its Trainer's orders. For ages, they have helped Trainers raise Pokémon.

data.name: Entei-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Brave Burn-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 150 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Seaking.

attacks.name: Undulate
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Seaking.

data.name: Energy Restore
rules: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, put a basic Energy card from your discard pile into your hand. If you don't have that many basic Energy cards in your discard pile, put all of them into your hand.

data.name: Mew ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Versatile
abilities.text: Mew ex can use the attacks of all Pokémon in play as its own. (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

attacks.name: Power Move
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Energy card and attach it to Mew ex. Shuffle your deck afterward. Then, you may switch Mew ex with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Hippopotas
data.flavorText: It enshrouds itself with sand to protect itself from germs. It does not enjoy getting wet.

data.name: Noivern-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Distort
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Item cards from their hand during their next turn.

attacks.name: Sonic Volume
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Special Energy cards from their hand during their next turn.

attacks.name: Boomburst-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Rare Candy
rules: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 1 or Stage 2 card that evolves from that Pokémon in your hand, put that card on the Basic Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.)

data.name: Red Card
rules: Your opponent shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck and draws 4 cards.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
